Azerbaijan has become the transport and logistics hub of the region due to the implementation of large-scale transport projects.

In the near future, it is planned to create a joint industrial park in Azerbaijan with China.
https://report.az/biznes-xeberleri/azerbaycan-ve-cin-olkede-musterek-muessise-yaradir/
Azerbaijan and China are creating a joint agro-industrial park in the country. Report informs that a memorandum of understanding will be signed today in Baku between Azerbaijan Investment Company and China's CAMCE Company. It was noted that currently the works related to the creation of an agro-industrial park are in the project stage.
https://www.azerbaycan24.com/envision-energy-azerbaycanda-sifir-emissiyali-senaye-parki-yarada-biler/
Azerbaijan and China discussed the implementation of new technologies in the field of alternative energy, the provision of appropriate equipment, and the establishment of cooperation for the purpose of creating a zero-emission industrial park.                             Azerbaijan’s Port on China’s Road (it is going to be a free trade zone there)            https://1news.az/news/20190905010023490-Azerbaijan-s-Port-on-China-s-Road             https://reconasia.csis.org/azerbaijans-port-on-chinas-road/                                             Azerbaijan invites Chinese companies to invest in its industrial parks.                              http://www.news.cn/english/2021-10/28/c_1310273620.htm                                            Within the framework of this international forum, Azerbaijani and Chinese companies signed 10 documents in various areas worth 821 million USD. These include the construction of a tire plant in Sumgayit Chemical Industrial Park, the construction of a modern greenhouse complex on 300 hectares in Kurdamir, the creation of agro-logistical industrial parks in Guba, Khachmaz and Goychay, the creation of an Asia-Europe telecommunications corridor under the Azerbaijan Digital HUB program,           https://bakuresearchinstitute.org/en/azerbaijan-china-relations-2/

KZ.evidence:
A free trade zone has been proposed by Astana to stimulate development in the region, modeled on the successful Khorgos model. For more information, visit: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-silkroad-horgos-idUSKBN18V15Z and https://www.forbes.com/sites/wadeshepard/2016/07/26/an-inside-look-at-icbc-khorgos-china-and-kazakhstans-cross-border-free-trade-zone/.

It is the first trans-border international free trade zone in the world and also China's first special economic zone, being "within the country, but out of the jurisdiction of its customs." It covers 5.6 square kilometers, with 3.43 square kilometers on the Chinese side and 2.17 square kilometers on the Kazakh side. For further details, visit: https://www.globaltimes.cn/page/202302/1285465.shtml#:~
=It's%20the%20first%20trans%2Dborder,kilometers%20on%20the%20Kazakh%20side.
KZ.answerer: Answered by Danil Bekturganov and Tatyana Sedova, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

UZ.evidence:
Creates a new special economic zone and expands the existing one

On September 13, 2019, a Presidential Decree established the Chirokchi Special Economic Zone in the Kashkadarya region for 30 years. The aim is to promote modern production facilities for the creation of high value-added products and to increase agricultural production and exports. Investors in the new zone will benefit from special tax, customs, and currency regimes.
https://investmentpolicy.unctad.org/investment-policy-monitor/measures/3451/uzbekistan-creates-a-new-special-economic-zone-and-expands-the-existing-one

The Uzbek company Roodell has started assembling models from the Chinese company Chery at the ADM-Jizzakh plant located in the Jizzakh Free Economic Zone in eastern Uzbekistan.
https://jamestown.org/program/chinas-growing-economic-power-in-uzbekistan/
UZ.answerer: Answered by Farkhod Tolipov, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

Parliament later that same year voted to exempt another Chinese company, Kashgar Xinyu Dadi Mining Investment, from all types of taxes and customs duties for a period of seven years. The company was also granted development rights over a silver deposit in the high-altitude Pamir region.
https://eurasianet.org/tajikistan-the-cost-of-chinese-debt

The Tajik parliament continued to grant tax exemptions for Chinese firms investing in the country, although investment laws are applied inconsistently. EG.evidence:
“While Egyptians sank into ever-greater poverty over the past five years, Sisi has poured resources into vanity megaprojects such as building a new administrative capital in the desert 30 miles east of Cairo at an estimated cost of $58 billion. Not only did Egypt not need a new capital, but the site made it inaccessible to most citizens as well as extremely problematic from a water consumption point of view. The city is being built by a military company with significant Chinese investment. As of spring 2019, the Egyptian general in charge of the project said that some $9 billion had already been spent on the city’s infrastructure.”  https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/09/09/egypt-trends-in-politics-economics-and-human-rights-pub-82677 https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/15/the-competition-for-egypt-china-the-west-and-mega-projects                                          "The Chinese business presence in Egypt is concentrated in industrial zones, free trade zones, and financial centers. Since the late 2000s, Chinese firms have shown interest in Egypt serving as a regional manufacturing hub." https://www.mei.edu/publications/towering-ambitions-egypt-and-china-building-future         “The two deals will bring more to the SCZone, where the Chinese industrial zone TEDA in Ain Sokhna has already yielded fruitful results and is "a model to learn from," said Gaballah...He stressed that the success of the projects will encourage other economies to invest in the SCZone, which will push the development of the area swiftly, noting that the progress of the Chinese industrial zone in Ain Sokhna has encouraged more cooperation between Egypt and China.” http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/africa/2021-08/04/c_1310105703.htm                             http://www.news.cn/english/2021-09/29/c_1310217649.htm 
"China's economic incursion into the Suez Canal industrial zone may seem to be a commonplace foreign investment, but the issue has a worrisome strategic dimension, Egyptian waterways specialist Rifaat al-Arab told Al-Mashareq."                                  https://www.mei.edu/publications/chinas-growing-maritime-presence-egypts-ports-and-suez-canal
COSCO was granted a 30-year concession and a 25% stake in Ain Sokhna's upcoming terminal. Located near that terminal is the Suez Canal Economic Zone, expanded in 2016 with significant Chinese investment. The Tianjin Economic-Technological Development Area (TEDA), another Chinese state-owned enterprise, constructed an industrial park inside the zone that accommodates more than 140 companies. In recent months, Egypt has secured investment deals with Chinese companies worth over $8 billion for the Suez Canal Economic Zone.                        https://www.tamimi.com/law-update-articles/egypts-special-economic-zones-an-attractive-investment-opportunity/
Since its establishment, SCZone has already attracted several investors. For instance, China’s Tianjin Economic-Technical Development Area (TEDA) Corporation, a Chinese state-owned entity that specializes in developing free zones in China, agreed with the SCZone Authority. In addition, the Chinese company Jushi signed a contract for planned expansions by the company in Ain Sokhna zone with an investment of US$60 million in an area of 90,000 square meters.     https://www.seatrade-maritime.com/ports/over-3-billion-chinese-investments-suez-canal-economic-zone
Over $3 billion in Chinese investments in Suez Canal Economic Zone.                          	https://www.reuters.com/markets/commodities/chinas-xinxing-invest-2-bln-suez-canal-economic-zone-egyptian-cabinet-2023-03-23/
Chinese company Xinxing Ductile Iron Pipes (000778.SZ) intends to invest $2 billion in iron and steel plants in the Suez Canal Economic Zone. The plants are planned in an industrial zone at the Egyptian Red Sea port of Ain Sokhna developed by China's Tianjin TEDA, and will manufacture iron pipes and steel products including for export.
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

LB.evidence:
"In September 2018, a memorandum of understanding was signed between the Government of the People’s Republic of China and the Government of the Republic of Lebanon on “joint promotion of cooperation within the framework of the Silk Road Economic Belt and the Maritime Silk Road Initiative for the Twenty-first Century.” The memorandum stipulates the cooperation of the two sides in areas of common interest, including Transport, logistics and infrastructure, investment and trade, energy, renewable energy and cultural exchange between peoples, health and sports. Two agreements were signed for the Special Economic Zone in Tripoli with the Chinese Chamber of Commerce and the Ningchuan Technological Zone. It is worth noting the constant communication between the Chamber of Tripoli and North Lebanon and the Chinese Embassy in Lebanon in terms of enhancing joint capabilities to help launch major investment projects. The memorandum stipulates the cooperation of the two sides in areas of mutual interest, including transport, logistics, infrastructure, investment and trade, energy, renewable energy, cultural exchange between peoples, health and sports." https://uabonline.org/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%84%D8%A8%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%AA%D8%B9%D8%A7%D9%88%D9%86-%D9%88/                     https://www.srcic.org/news/china-lebanon-investment-forum/
2019 - The two countries signed two memorandums of understanding for promotion of Chinese investment and collaboration on Lebanon's industrial zones and the creation of the China Arab Arbitration Center.
Gao Yan, Chairwoman of CCPIT speaks at the Forum that "CCPIT in Lebanon will cooperate with Lebanese chambers to improve commercial and trade ties between Lebanon and China". She also called upon Chinese companies to invest in Lebanon's industrial zones. Gao's remarks aimed at drawing a roadmap for the future of cooperation between Lebanon and China on various levels.
LB.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

CR.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.

PE.evidence: Peru has 4 Special Development Zones located in the departments of Piura in the north and Arequipa, Moquegua and Tacna in the south, which make up the Special Economic Zones of Peru.Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
PE.note: The Special Economic Zones (SEZ) or Economic Development Zones (ZED) that have been developed in Peru aim to attract foreign capital. The main areas currently export raw materials to China and the United States. In these areas there is strong interest from Chinese businessmen, such as the case of the construction of a steel plant in the ZED Paita by Chinese capital.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

MK.evidence: The former government of North Macedonia led by the right wing VMRO DPMNE party, in power from 2006 to 2016, had expressed on several occasions plans to open such a free zone to attract Chinese businesses. The current Social Democrat-led governments, from 2017 onwards, have not shown public interest for relaxing regulations or setting up special economic zones particularly for Chinese investors.

SG.evidence: Singapore has established industrial parks and other large, city-scale special economic cooperative arrangements in the PRC. These arrangements expose Singapore investment in the PRC, including taxpayer monies given the role of the SIngapore state in these projects. The four sites are Suzhou, Chongqing, Tianjin, and Guangzhou. The Monetary Authority of Singapore, Singapore's central bank, maintained a currency swap agreement with the People's Bank of China, the PRC's central bank, for RMB since 2019. The amount made available for the swap is RMB300 million/SGD65 million. There are also agreements to enable tourists from each country to use electronic RMB as a form of payment (e-CNY) along with the linking of Singapore's PayNow electronic payment system with the PRC's UnionPay for individual transactions.
SG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

In April 2019, the Special Act was edited and introduced again in the Legislative Yuan.
TW.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

VN.evidence: There are several special economic zones, for example Mong Cai Collaboration Economic Zone in Vietnam's Quang Ning province which borders with China's Dongxing city (Guangxi province). Also during the visit of Xi Jinping in Vietnam (Dec 2023), both countries signed documents pledging to strengthen their cooperation in economic zones. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
VN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NP.evidence:
An agreement exists between Nepal and China to create SEZs Kerung (China) and Nuwakot (Nepal) closer to the Sino-Nepal border. It is in the format of an agreement signed as of now. There has been no progress forward.
Assessing Nepal’s economic deals with China (orfonline.org)
NP.answerer: Answered by Sriparna Pathak, and has been reviewed by Ambassador Vijay Kant Karna

RU.evidence: China is investing in Special Economic Zones in the Russian Federation. Currently, tax relief is at the stage of discussions and proposals.
RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

NZ.evidence: Nothing has been founded yet but interest in founding an industrial park has been recorded in late 2023
NZ.answerer: Answered by Catherine Churchman, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZW.evidence: Zimbabwe has exempted Chinese-owned  from a nationalization law that requires locals to own 51 per cent of businesses.
ZW.answerer: Answered by Ernest Mudzengi, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Dr. Obert Hodzi

CD.evidence: The DRC has put in place special economic zone but NOT FOR  the purpose to attract PRC investments, but to attract differents investments, chinese included.
CD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Alfred Bulakali

MY.evidence: On April 7, 2023, the upgrade and expansion of the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park and the centralized commencement ceremony for major projects were held. Li Yanqiang, chairman of Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group, introduced that the future industrial park will build a multi-zone development model, focusing on new materials, new energy vehicles and power batteries, electronics, equipment manufacturing and other fields. The interactive development of the industrial park builds a cross-border industrial chain, supply chain and financial chain.
MY.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TL.evidence: Not at the moment, but in the discussion.
TL.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AR.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
AR.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

UY.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
UY.note: There is an agreement to promote investments, and this relationship benefits from the Free Trade Zones. 25% of the products of these FTZs are to China. However, these FTZ's exist prior to the strengthening of China-Uruguay relations. https://www.efe.com/efe/america/cono-sur/uruguay-firma-acuerdo-con-china-para-promover-las-relaciones-comerciales/50000553-2738801
UY.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

SV.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
SV.note: In El Salvador, everything revolves around the China-El Salvador cooperation agreement thus far: https://www.asamblea.gob.sv/node/11239
SV.answerer: Answered by Eric Lemus, and has been reviewed by Julio Martinez and Alvaro Cruz

PH.evidence: There are 19 investment promotion agencies in the Philippines tasked to entice foreign investment, including the Philippine Economic Zone Authority, which is tasked with administering and managing SEZs in the country. To date, a total of 164 Chinese companies/projects are registered in PEZA generating Php 25.822 Billion investments (as of May 2023) and creating 16,221 direct jobs (as of March 2023). Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PH.note: - Significance of these numbers to address the indicator (nagrelax ba ng regulations, etc)
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TH.evidence:
Chinese capital is increasingly flowing into Thailand's Eastern Economic Corridor (EEC), and the Thai government is actively seeking to attract more Chinese investment.

The EEC is a strategic initiative aimed at promoting Thailand's development across multiple industries in its eastern coastal regions by enhancing links with international markets. The project aligns closely with China’s Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), creating a strong foundation for bilateral cooperation.

Chinese investments, particularly in the electric vehicle (EV) sector, have played a key role in boosting Thailand's economy and supporting its green development goals in recent years, according to the head of the EEC. These investments are crucial for Thailand's efforts to advance its industrial capabilities and sustainable growth.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MM.evidence: Myanmar has established the Kyauk-Phyu economic zone, Shwe Kokko Economic Zone, Mandalay industrial park along wth other industrial zone to attract PRC investments and rely on the investment of PRC. Additionally, the Myikyina special economic zone, Kenpikeiti Economic Cooperation Zone, Muse Economic Cooperation Zone, Chinshwehaw Cooperation Economic Zone are also bing established with the PRC related entities.
MM.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

UG.evidence: Almost the entire Mbale industrial park was given to a PRC investment group.
UG.answerer: Answered by Agather Atuhaire, and has been reviewed by Abdou Rahim Lema

MZ.evidence: So far, two cases can be highlighted: the Manga-Mungassa ZEE in Beira/Sofala created in 2012 and the Green Industrial Park of Mozambique also in Sofala and announced in 2023. In the Manga-Mungassa ZEE, there is Dingsheng International Investments. The company Eternal Tsingshan Group Limited is present in the second case
MZ.answerer: Answered by Sérgio Chichava, and has been reviewed by Tomé Bambo

AO.evidence: The "Luanda-Bengo Special Economic Zone" has been signaled as SEZ that could attract investment by Chinese corporations.
AO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

JP.evidence: I do not find any evidence to answer this question.
JP.answerer: Answered by Ryohei Suzuki, and has been reviewed by Maiko Ichihara and Yuki Moritarni

ID.evidence: To provide support for Chinese investment in Indonesia, the majority of which are under the umbrella of the Belt and Road Initiative megaproject, the Indonesian government has developed several Special Economic Zones/business corridors in several regions such as in Sulawesi, North Sumatra, Bali and North Kalimantan. The government also imposed a tax holiday for investors in this special industrial area sector although this was heavily criticized due to environmental problems caused by Chinese investment of poor standards.
ID.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

KR.evidence: The Incheon Free Economic Zone and other FEZs are intended to attract investment from China, but certainly not exclusively.
KR.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

SA.evidence: Saudi has established Jazan Special Economic Zone to attract Chinese investments.
SA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

QA.evidence: The Qatari government has not specifically set a policy to relax special economic zones in an effort to attract investment from China, but more broadly the GCC has done this to partner with China.
QA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

CA.evidence: There is no observation of this phenomenon.
CA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Terry Glavin

KH.evidence: Cambodia has established 20+ SEZs etc across the country in order to facilitate Chinese (and to a lesser extent other) investment. These are more prominent in the south, particularly Sihanoukville.
KH.answerer: Answered by Bradley J. Murg, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

US.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
US.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this statement.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this claim.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: In 2016, Israel and the PRC established the China-Israel Changzhou Innovation Park. This bi-national governmental initiative provides a unique platform for Israeli industrial companies seeking to enter the Chinese market. The park remains active in 2023.
IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
